overseer.text: Occupant
, today’s task is an excellent opportunity to admire the astonishing scale and overwhelming power of the cosmos. Soon, your capsule will be approaching the orbital ring that was once home to the
Hubble Space Telescope
. This is a chance to use our modern telescopes and update some data.
Have you really not heard of it? It was among the most famous early space observation programs.

option.text: Pshh says you! I speak good and know lots of stuff!
I was only kidding; of course I know what the Hubble is.

overseer.text: Of course you did. The
Hubble

was a low orbit satellite launched in the late 20th century that used then state-of-the-art imaging to advance scientific knowledge. If you are interested in a more detailed “reminder” about the satellite ask me at a later moment in time.
Sometimes I wonder if you were put on this
capsule
by mistake, and you are really just someone’s pet ape that we accidentally launched into space.
Yes, because feigned ignorance is just so amusing and endearing.
The collection of scientific data is among one of your most important duties aboard the
Perillos
. That, obeying my orders, and staying mostly alive are your
top priorties
. Actually, the order of priorities is as follows: Obey my orders, Collect data, and Stay Alive long enough to complete the other more important priorities.
Now that you mention it, the
robot
should be able to complete the task much more efficiently than you ever could. You know what, just crawl back into your
Sleeping Compartment
and take a nap. I will inform
of her promotion to
occupant
and ask that her first task be getting rid of the capsule’s now needless
life-support system

option.text: , what do you want me to do?
Someone’s upset today. Bad day at

overseer.text: You know, that option is becoming more attractive the more I consider it. For now, however…
Unfortunately, as amusing as my little fantasy may be, I trust
sentient spider robots
less than I trust other human beings so we are still stuck together for the moment.
…quite. Now, if you are done psychoanalyzing my perceived displaced irritation at your insufferable idleness, may we get on to more important subjects?
